jobDescription: Humanyze helps companies make more informed people decisions. Born out of the MIT Media Lab, Humanyze uncovers the hidden patterns of digital and face-to-face communication to quantify the people factor in the workplace. Humanyze is committed to helping teams work better together and has the data and science to prove it.  Humanyze’s world-leading People Analytics Platform delivers advanced insights and is used by top Fortune 500 companies to answer specific business questions around diversity and inclusion, collaboration and delivery, space planning, workload, teamwork and engagement, and regulatory and compliance risk. Role Description: We’re looking for a Network Scientist to join our Analytics R&D; Team to work along with data scientists, statistical analysts, computational social scientists, and organizational behavior scientists. This position will be responsible for designing algorithms and methods to ensure the quality and robustness of our network-based metrics that reveal how work gets done in organizations. The network scientist will help uncover organizational behaviors from multi-dimensional communication and collaboration network data collected from real-world organizations.  This is a full-time role based in Palo Alto, CA.
